For example, when an employee of USA-based company Contoso, using GSA, travels to China. \n+ - This scenario includes use cases where Global Secure Access (GSA) customers with a presence in multiple geographies and tenants deployed outside China use Global Secure Access while in China. For example, when an employee of USA-based company Contoso, using Global Secure Access, travels to China. \n \n However, it’s important to recognize the specific connectivity disclaimers that apply to Secure Access Service Edge (SASE) providers operating in China. Because of regulatory restrictions and local infrastructure requirements, SASE providers might encounter: \n - **Service limitations**: Connectivity performance can vary because of internet regulations and restrictions on VPN usage. Local routing policies can also affect network latency and bandwidth. Because connectivity is unpredictable, user experience might vary. "28c01d10f60733e62cb0162d6ad2e039c3b2b6cf", "filename": "docs/id-governance/licensing-fundamentals.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 5, "deletions": 3, "changes": 8, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/64355df0dea6edcf1d38cebfb2e328d8bb495502/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flicensing-fundamentals.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/64355df0dea6edcf1d38cebfb2e328d8bb495502/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flicensing-fundamentals.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flicensing-fundamentals.md?ref=64355df0dea6edcf1d38cebfb2e328d8bb495502", "patch": "@@ -19,7 +19,7 @@ The following licenses are available for use with Microsoft Entra ID Governance\n - **Free** - Included with Microsoft cloud subscriptions such as Microsoft Azure, Microsoft 365, and others.\n - **Microsoft Entra ID P1** - Microsoft Entra ID P1 is available as a standalone product or included with Microsoft 365 E3 for enterprise customers and Microsoft 365 Business Premium for small to medium businesses. \n - **Microsoft Entra ID P2** - Microsoft Entra ID P2 is available as a standalone product or included with Microsoft 365 E5 for enterprise customers.\n-- **Microsoft Entra ID Governance** - Microsoft Entra ID Governance is an advanced set of identity governance capabilities available for Microsoft Entra ID P1 and P2 customers. Microsoft Entra ID Governance is available as six products **Microsoft Entra ID Governance**, **Microsoft Entra ID Governance Step Up for Microsoft Entra ID P2**, **Entra ID Governance Frontline Worker**, **Microsoft Entra ID Governance Step up for Microsoft Entra ID F2**, **Microsoft Entra ID Governance for Government** and **Microsoft Entra ID Governance Add-on for Microsoft Entra ID P2 for Government**. These six products differ only in their prerequisites; they contain both the entitlement management, privileged identity management and access reviews capabilities that were in Microsoft Entra ID P2, and additional advanced identity governance capabilities.\n+- **Microsoft Entra ID Governance** - Microsoft Entra ID Governance is an advanced set of identity governance capabilities available for Microsoft Entra ID P1 and P2 customers. Microsoft Entra ID Governance is available as six products **Microsoft Entra ID Governance**, **Microsoft Entra ID Governance Step Up for Microsoft Entra ID P2**, **Entra ID Governance Frontline Worker**, **Microsoft Entra ID Governance Step up for Microsoft Entra ID F2**, **Microsoft Entra ID Governance for Government** and **Microsoft Entra ID Governance Add-on for Microsoft Entra ID P2 for Government**. These six products differ only in their prerequisites; they contain both the entitlement management, privileged identity management and access reviews capabilities that were in Microsoft Entra ID P2, and additional advanced identity governance capabilities. The following section goes into more detail on the different prerequisites of these products.\n - **Microsoft Entra Suite** - Microsoft Entra Suite is a complete cloud-based solution for workforce access, available for Microsoft Entra ID P1 and P2 customers. Microsoft Entra Suite brings together **Microsoft Entra Private Access**, **Microsoft Entra Internet Access**, **Microsoft Entra ID Governance**, **Microsoft Entra ID Protection**, and **Microsoft Entra Verified ID**. The Microsoft Entra ID Governance portion provides the same identity governance capabilities as the **Microsoft Entra ID Governance** product. The difference is that they have different prerequisites.\n \n >[!NOTE]\n@@ -53,6 +53,8 @@ To check if the prerequisite products for a Microsoft Entra ID Governance produc\n \n 1. To view the existing products in the tenant, in the **Manage** menu, select **All products**.\n \n+Governance of guest users requires an Azure subscription be selected for guest billing. For more information, see: [Microsoft Entra ID Governance licensing for guest users](microsoft-entra-id-governance-licensing-for-guest-users.md).\n+\n ## Starting a trial\n \n A Global Administrator in a commercial tenant that has an appropriate prerequisite product, such as Microsoft Entra ID P1, already purchased, and isn't already using or has previously trialed Microsoft Entra ID Governance, can request a trial of Microsoft Entra ID Governance in their tenant.\n@@ -78,7 +80,7 @@ A Global Administrator in a commercial tenant that has an appropriate prerequisi\n \n ## API-driven provisioning\n \n-This feature is available with Microsoft Entra ID P1, P2, and Microsoft Entra ID Governance subscriptions. A subscription license is required for every identity that is sourced using the [/bulkUpload](/graph/api/synchronization-synchronizationjob-post-bulkupload) API and provisioned to either on-premises Active Directory or Microsoft Entra ID.\n+This feature is available with Microsoft Entra ID P1, P2, and Microsoft Entra ID Governance subscriptions. A subscription license is required with enough seats for every identity that is sourced using the [/bulkUpload](/graph/api/synchronization-synchronizationjob-post-bulkupload) API and provisioned to either on-premises Active Directory or Microsoft Entra ID.\n \n ### License scenarios\n \n@@ -91,7 +93,7 @@ This feature is available with Microsoft Entra ID P1, P2, and Microsoft Entra ID\n \n ### Do licenses need to be assigned to users to use Identity Governance features?\n \n-Users don't need to be assigned a Microsoft Entra ID Governance license, but there needs to be as many licenses to include all users in scope of, or who configures, the Identity Governance features.\n+Users don't need to be assigned a Microsoft Entra ID Governance license, but there needs to be as many licenses to include all member users in scope of, or who configures, the Identity Governance features. In addition, the guest billing model must be enabled if there are guest users to be governed, as described in the next answer.\n \n ### How can I license usage of Microsoft Entra ID Governance features for business guests?\n " }, { "sha": "e8079aa7d3ec252c22276df8a69187d618fc01ac", "filename": "docs/includes/licensing-governance.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 8, "deletions": 8, "changes": 16, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/64355df0dea6edcf1d38cebfb2e328d8bb495502/docs%2Fincludes%2Flicensing-governance.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/64355df0dea6edcf1d38cebfb2e328d8bb495502/docs%2Fincludes%2Flicensing-governance.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Flicensing-governance.md?ref=64355df0dea6edcf1d38cebfb2e328d8bb495502", "patch": "@@ -9,7 +9,7 @@ ms.author: billmath\n ms.custom: include file\n ---\n \n-The following table shows the licensing requirements for Microsoft Entra ID Governance features. Microsoft Entra Suite includes all features of Microsoft Entra ID Governance. Licensing information and example license scenarios for Entitlement management, Access reviews, and Lifecycle Workflows are provided following the table.\n+The following table shows the licensing requirements for Microsoft Entra ID Governance features for member users. Microsoft Entra Suite includes all features of Microsoft Entra ID Governance. Licensing information and example license scenarios for Entitlement management, Access reviews, and Lifecycle Workflows are provided following the table.\n \n ### Features by license\n \n@@ -55,7 +55,7 @@ The following table shows what features associated with identity governance are\n \n ### Entitlement Management\n \n-Using this feature requires Microsoft Entra ID Governance subscriptions for your organization's users. Some capabilities within this feature can operate with a Microsoft Entra ID P2 subscription.\n+Using this feature requires a Microsoft Entra ID Governance subscription for your organization's member users. Some capabilities within this feature can operate with a Microsoft Entra ID P2 subscription. Some capabilities within this feature require guest billing.\n \n #### Example license scenarios\n \n@@ -68,17 +68,17 @@ Here are some example license scenarios to help you determine the number of lice\n \n ### Access reviews\n \n-Using this feature requires Microsoft Entra ID Governance subscriptions for your organization's users, including for all employees who are reviewing access or having their access reviewed. Some capabilities within this feature might operate with a Microsoft Entra ID P2 subscription.\n+Using this feature requires a Microsoft Entra ID Governance subscription for your organization's member users, including for all employees who are reviewing access or having their access reviewed. Some capabilities within this feature might operate with a Microsoft Entra ID P2 subscription. Some capabilities within this feature require guest billing.\n \n #### Example license scenarios\n \n Here are some example license scenarios to help you determine the number of licenses you must have.\n \n | Scenario | Calculation | Number of licenses |\n | --- | --- | --- |\n-| An administrator creates an access review of Group A with 75 users and 1 group owner, and assigns the group owner as the reviewer. | 1 license for the group owner as reviewer, and 75 licenses for the 75 users. | 76 |\n-| An administrator creates an access review of Group B with 500 users and 3 group owners, and assigns the 3 group owners as reviewers. | 500 licenses for users, and 3 licenses for each group owner as reviewers. | 503 |\n-| An administrator creates an access review of Group B with 500 users. Makes it a self-review. | 500 licenses for each user as self-reviewers | 500 |\n+| An administrator creates an access review of Group A with 75 member users and 1 group owner, and assigns the group owner as the reviewer. | 1 license for the group owner as reviewer, and 75 licenses for the 75 users. | 76 |\n+| An administrator creates an access review of Group B with 500 member users and 3 group owners, and assigns the 3 group owners as reviewers. | 500 licenses for users, and 3 licenses for each group owner as reviewers. | 503 |\n+| An administrator creates an access review of Group B with 500 member users. Makes it a self-review. | 500 licenses for each user as self-reviewers | 500 |\n | An administrator creates an access review of Group C with 50 member users. Makes it a self-review. | 50 licenses for each user as self-reviewers. | 50 |\n | An administrator creates an access review of Group D with 6 member users. Makes it a self-review. | 6 licenses for each user as self-reviewers. No additional licenses are required. | 6 |\n \n@@ -91,11 +91,11 @@ With Microsoft Entra ID Governance licenses for Lifecycle Workflows, you can:\n - Manage and configure existing tasks to create workflows that are specific to your needs.\n - Create up to 100 custom task extensions to be used in your workflows.\n \n-Using this feature requires Microsoft Entra ID Governance subscriptions for your organization's users.\n+Using this feature requires a Microsoft Entra ID Governance subscription for your organization's member users. Some capabilities within this feature require guest billing.\n \n #### Example license scenarios\n \n | Scenario | Calculation | Number of licenses |\n | --- | --- | --- |\n-| A Lifecycle Workflows Administrator creates a workflow to add new hires in the Marketing department to the Marketing teams group. 250 new hires are assigned to the Marketing teams group via this workflow once. Other 150 new hires are assigned to the Marketing teams group via this workflow later the same year. | 1 license for the Lifecycle Workflows Administrator, and 400 licenses for the users. | 401 |\n+| A Lifecycle Workflows Administrator creates a workflow to add new hires in the Marketing department to the Marketing teams group. 250 new hire member users are assigned to the Marketing teams group via this workflow once. Other 150 new hire member users are assigned to the Marketing teams group via this workflow later the same year. | 1 license for the Lifecycle Workflows Administrator, and 400 licenses for the users. | 401 |\n | A Lifecycle Workflows Administrator creates a workflow to pre-offboard a group of employees before their last day of employment. The scope of users who will be pre-offboarded are 40 users once. We offboard 40 licensed users. Now, we can re-assign these 40 licenses and assign 10 more licenses later in the year to pre-offboard 50 more users.| 50 licenses for users, and 1 license for the Lifecycle Workflows Administrator. | 51 |" } ]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response: The changes include updates to documentation regarding Global Secure Access support in China, clarifying that support is for tenants deployed outside China. There are also numerous additions and modifications to the documentation for Microsoft Entra ID Governance, specifically concerning application integrations, licensing requirements for member and guest users, and the prerequisites for various Entra ID Governance products. These updates aim to provide clearer guidance on licensing and feature availability within the Microsoft Entra ID ecosystem.

author: prmerger-automator[bot]
message:
Merge pull request #9974 from sumeetmittal/patch-30

Clarify Global Secure Access usage scenarios in China

  "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/415559ad970010dd0ca0372b7a8bc21ee7844860/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Freference-china-user-support.md",
  "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Freference-china-user-support.md?ref=415559ad970010dd0ca0372b7a8bc21ee7844860",
  "patch": "@@ -18,7 +18,7 @@ Microsoft supports Global Secure Access capabilities in China, offering secure a\n There are two scenarios that are applicable to Global Secure Access in China:      \n - Global Secure Access availability for **customer tenants deployed on Microsoft Azure in China**. **Microsoft currently doesn’t support this scenario**. \n - Global Secure Access availability for **customer tenants deployed on Microsoft Azure outside China**. **Microsoft supports this scenario**.\n-  - This scenario includes use cases where Global Secure Access (GSA) customers with a presence in multiple geographies and tenants deployed outside China use GSA while in China. For example, when an employee of USA-based company Contoso, using GSA, travels to China.     \n+  - This scenario includes use cases where Global Secure Access (GSA) customers with a presence in multiple geographies and tenants deployed outside China use Global Secure Access while in China. For example, when an employee of USA-based company Contoso, using Global Secure Access, travels to China.     \n \n However, it’s important to recognize the specific connectivity disclaimers that apply to Secure Access Service Edge (SASE) providers operating in China. Because of regulatory restrictions and local infrastructure requirements, SASE providers might encounter:    \n - **Service limitations**: Connectivity performance can vary because of internet regulations and restrictions on VPN usage. Local routing policies can also affect network latency and bandwidth. Because connectivity is unpredictable, user experience might vary. "
}. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response: This commit modifies the documentation regarding Global Secure Access support in China. The change clarifies that Microsoft *does* support Global Secure Access for tenants deployed outside China, even when users are physically located in China. It also reiterates that Global Secure Access is *not* currently supported for tenants deployed on Microsoft Azure within China. The update includes a minor wording adjustment for improved clarity on the supported scenario.
